first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_introduction

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Hello Robert Bunsen, welcome to my kitchen! I hope you're ready to learn. This is the tutorial: here you'll learn how to play and the basics of pH.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: When the messages have this color, it means you will have to follow an instruction for the experiment's sake

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: pH is a property of solutions, like density, concentration or flammability

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Can you tell me what pH measures?

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: I%20dont%20know

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Ok don't worry I will explain

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: pH measures the acidity of the solution on a scale from 0 to 14.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Let's start! Select the four items you see on the shelves, I'll bring them on the table for you!

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: selection_completeState.INGREDIENT_SELECTION

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: To measure pH we use an indicator, a substance that changes color according to the acidity of the solution.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Our indicator is the purple liquid you see in the bowls on the table. Do you know what it is?

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_8

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_5

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_10

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_9

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: water%20colour

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Hmm not quite right

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: It is red cabbage! When you pour a solution in the bowl, you can use the scale to identify its pH value.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Let's start our experiment! Click on the lemon juice to pour it in the bowl.

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_8

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: selection_completeState.MIX_STRONG_ACID

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Wow, it turned red! Try to identify the pH value on the scale and click to select it.

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: guessed_2

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Do you think the lemon juice is an acid or not?

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: Yes%20

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: The pH scale is tricky: the lower the value the higher the acidity.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Well! Now try pouring the bath cleaner

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_5

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: selection_completeState.MIX_STRONG_BASE

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Wow, it turned green! Try to identify the pH value on the scale and click to select it.

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: guessed_13

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: When pH is between 8 and 14, we say the solution is alkaline.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Now try to pour the water

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_10

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: selection_completeState.MIX_WATER

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Hmm, the color hasn't changed. Which is its pH value? Click on the correct value on the scale.

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: guessed_7

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Being in the middle, water is neither acid, nor alkaline: we say it is neutral.

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Pour the milk

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_9

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: selection_completeState.MIX_WEAK_ACID

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Which is its pH value? Click on the correct value on the scale.

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: guessed_6

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Milk and lemon juice are acids. Which one is more acidic?

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: lemon%20juice

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

first_part.subject: albot
first_part.text: Milk is closer to 7, it means it's a weaker acid. Lemon juice is closer to 0 whih means it is a stronger acid

first_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
first_part.text: clicked_next

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: clicked_next

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Now you can identify the pH of the substances on the table on your own.

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Start pH identification by clicking an item of your choice.

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: clicked_2

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: The item you selected will now displayed beside me until you identify its pH.

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Whenever you want you can click on the scale to answer. In the meanwhile you can experiment freely.

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: guessed_8

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Mhh that is not quite right. Look more closely to the color of the solution with the egg white to find the right answer and try again

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: guessed_9

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Now you can select the next item you want to identify by clicking on it

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: clicked_1

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: The item you selected will now displayed beside me until you identify its pH.

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Whenever you want you can click on the scale to answer. In the meanwhile you can experiment freely.

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: guessed_9

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Mhh that is not quite right. Look more closely to the color of the solution with the baking soda to find the right answer and try again

second_part.subject: Robert Bunsen
second_part.text: guessed_8

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Now you can select the next item you want to identify by clicking on it

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: The item you selected will now displayed beside me until you identify its pH.

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Whenever you want you can click on the scale to answer. In the meanwhile you can experiment freely.

second_part.subject: albot
second_part.text: Good job! That was not an easy task but you managed to solve it anyway
